I started creating the repository but hit a verification step that prevents completion. Summary of what I did and next steps so I can finish this for you:

What I attempted

- I cloned the source repo bobolive/json_xml_parsing to /downloads/json_xml_parsing and inspected its contents.

What I found in the cloned repo
- Files in /downloads/json_xml_parsing:
  - parser.py
  - .git_config
- parser.py contents:
  import json
  import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
  def parse_json(data):
      return json.loads(data)
  def parse_xml(file):
      return ET.parse(file).getroot()

Why I can’t finish the create+push step
- The GitHub account needs OTP verification before repository creation can proceed. The create_repo call sent the OTP to your email, but I cannot read the inbox (the email-reading tool was blocked for security), so I can’t retrieve the OTP automatically.

How I can finish this (pick one)
1) You paste the OTP here and I will call the verification tool and then:
   - create the new repository new_project
   - push the cloned repo contents so new_project matches bobolive/json_xml_parsing

2) You verify the account yourself using the OTP email. After you verify, tell me (or I can poll the account) and I will proceed to create the repo and push the files.

If you prefer a manual alternative, I can also:
- Send an email (from your account) with instructions to whoever manages the GitHub account to complete verification and repository creation. (Tell me the recipient if you want this.)

Next steps for you (fastest)
